intro: Balsamita annua, commonly known as annual balsam, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Balsamita annua is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and has a long history of use in traditional herbal medicine.
